name: DCH Blood Spot Outcome IVA SnCT
description: A code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system that describes the outcome of the blood spot screening for isovaleric acidaemia.
copyright: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright Â© 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement.

concept.display: Newborn blood spot specimen received
Isovaleric acidaemia screening declined
Isovaleric acidaemia screening declined, no history of being screened
Isovaleric acidaemia screening declined, screened in UK (as reported by parents) with no evidence of result
Isovaleric acidaemia screening declined, screened outside UK with evidence of result
Isovaleric acidaemia screening declined, screened outside UK with no evidence of result
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, repeat screening with further sample required
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, too young for reliable screening
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, sample taken too soon after blood transfusion (less than 72 hours)
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, insufficient sample
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample (blood quality): incorrect blood application
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample (blood quality): compressed/damaged
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample: day 0 and day 5 on same card
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample: National Health Service number missing/not accurately recorded
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample: date of sample missing/not accurately recorded
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample: date of birth not accurately matched
sovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample: expired card used
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample: more than 14 days in transit, too old for analysis
Isovaleric acidaemia screening, unsuitable sample: damaged in transit
Isovaleric acidaemia not suspected
Isovaleric acidaemia not suspected and other disorders follow up required
Suspected isovaleric acidaemia
Isovaleric acidaemia not screened for or screening incomplete
Isovaleric acidaemia not screened for or screening incomplete: over 1 year old, too old for screening
Isovaleric acidaemia, not screened for or screening incomplete, moved out of area
Isovaleric acidaemia not screened for or screening incomplete, not contactable, reasonable efforts made
Isovaleric acidaemia not screened for or screening incomplete, baby died
Isovaleric acidaemia not screened for or screening incomplete, not required, previous valid result
